title: World's most asked questions: how can I get rid of the hiccups?

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary muscle responsible for breathing that is also involved in the cause of hiccups?

options.label: A
options.text: It stimulates the vagus nerve, causing more hiccups.

options.label: B
options.text: It provides a confusing stimulus for the vagus nerve, distracting it from the diaphragm.

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on the vagus nerve.

options.label: D
options.text: It relaxes the diaphragm, causing hiccups to stop.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: It increases the internal CO2 concentration.

options.label: D
options.text: It stops the diaphragm from contracting.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: It plays a vital role in breathing.

options.label: D
options.text: It has no effect on breathing.

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of a hiccup on the vocal folds?

options.label: C
options.text: It causes them to clamp shut.

options.label: D
options.text: It has no effect on the vocal folds.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of a hiccup on the diaphragm?

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on the diaphragm.

options.label: D
options.text: It causes the diaphragm to stop contracting.

What is the best way to prevent the sensation of pins and needles?

options.label: A
options.text: By sitting or leaning in one position for a while

options.label: B
options.text: By avoiding prolonged sitting or leaning in one position

title: Closed and open syllables | Learn to read

multiple-choice.question: What is an open syllable?

options.label: A
options.text: A syllable where the vowel makes a short sound

options.label: B
options.text: A syllable where the vowel says its letter name

options.label: C
options.text: A syllable with a double vowel

options.label: D
options.text: A syllable with a consonant sound

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following words is an example of a closed syllable?
What happens to the vowel sound in a closed syllable?

options.label: A
options.text: The vowel says its letter name

options.label: B
options.text: The vowel makes a short sound

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following words is an example of an open syllable?
What is the difference between an open and a closed syllable?

options.label: A
options.text: An open syllable has a consonant sound, while a closed syllable has a vowel sound

options.label: B
options.text: An open syllable has a vowel sound, while a closed syllable has a consonant sound

options.label: C
options.text: An open syllable has a short vowel sound, while a closed syllable has a long vowel sound

options.label: D
options.text: An open syllable has a vowel that says its letter name, while a closed syllable has a vowel that makes a short sound

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following words is an example of a word with a closed syllable?
What is the rule for determining whether a syllable is open or closed?

options.label: A
options.text: If the syllable ends with a consonant, it is open; if it ends with a vowel, it is closed

options.label: B
options.text: If the syllable ends with a vowel, it is open; if it ends with a consonant, it is closed

options.label: C
options.text: If the syllable has a short vowel sound, it is open; if it has a long vowel sound, it is closed

options.label: D
options.text: If the syllable has a vowel that says its letter name, it is open; if it has a vowel that makes a short sound, it is closed

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following words is an example of a word with an open syllable?
What happens to the vowel sound in an open syllable?

options.label: A
options.text: The vowel makes a short sound

options.label: B
options.text: The vowel says its letter name

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following statements is true about closed syllables?

options.label: A
options.text: Closed syllables always have a long vowel sound

options.label: B
options.text: Closed syllables always have a short vowel sound

options.label: C
options.text: Closed syllables have a vowel that makes a short sound

options.label: D
options.text: Closed syllables have a vowel that says its letter name

title: The L-iminator! | The double L spelling rule

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for when two words join together to form a new word?
What happens to one of the "l"s when the words "all though" and "although" join together to form a compound word?

options.label: C
options.text: It is changed to a different letter

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of combining the words "until" and "until" to form a compound word?

options.label: A
options.text: A new word is formed with two "l"s

options.label: B
options.text: A new word is formed with one "l"

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of understanding how words can be combined to form new meanings?

options.label: C
options.text: To understand the process of forming compound words

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for the process of eliminating one of the sounds or letters from the original words when forming compound words?
Which of the following is an example of a compound word?
What is the result of combining the words "all though" and "although" to form a compound word?

options.label: A
options.text: A new word is formed with two "l"s

options.label: B
options.text: A new word is formed with one "l"

multiple-choice.question: What happens to the "elves" in the scenario where the words "until" and "until" join together to form a compound word?

options.label: C
options.text: They are changed to a different letter

multiple-choice.question: What is the importance of understanding the process of forming compound words?

options.label: C
options.text: To understand the process of forming compound words

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of compound words?

options.label: A
options.text: They have only one sound or letter

options.label: B
options.text: They have only two sounds or letters

options.label: C
options.text: They have more than two sounds or letters

options.label: D
options.text: They have the same sound or letter

title: Human, capital & natural resources for kids | Types of resources

multiple-choice.question: What is a resource?

options.label: A
options.text: A thing that people use to meet their needs

options.label: B
options.text: A thing that people make to sell

options.label: C
options.text: A thing that people use to entertain themselves

options.label: D
options.text: A thing that people use to travel

multiple-choice.question: What are the three main types of resources?

options.label: A
options.text: Human resources, capital resources, and natural resources

options.label: B
options.text: Human resources, capital resources, and technology

options.label: C
options.text: Human resources, capital resources, and services

options.label: D
options.text: Human resources, natural resources, and goods

multiple-choice.question: What are human resources?

options.label: A
options.text: Goods that are made and used to provide a service

options.label: C
options.text: Things that are found on earth and can be used by people

options.label: D
options.text: Tools and equipment used to make goods

multiple-choice.question: What are capital resources?

options.label: B
options.text: Goods that are made and used to provide a service

options.label: C
options.text: Things that are found on earth and can be used by people

options.label: D
options.text: Tools and equipment used to make goods

multiple-choice.question: What are natural resources?

options.label: A
options.text: Goods that are made and used to provide a service

options.label: C
options.text: Things that are found on earth and can be used by people

options.label: D
options.text: Tools and equipment used to make goods

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a human resource?
What is an example of a capital resource?
What is an example of a natural resource?
What is a service?

options.label: A
options.text: A thing that someone does for you

options.label: B
options.text: A thing that someone makes for you

options.label: C
options.text: A thing that someone sells to you

options.label: D
options.text: A thing that someone uses to entertain themselves

multiple-choice.question: What are goods?

options.label: A
options.text: Things that you use, eat, or drink

options.label: B
options.text: Things that you make to sell

options.label: C
options.text: Things that you use to entertain yourself

options.label: D
options.text: Things that you use to travel
